Class MyPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • MyPolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Polygon>, Polygon
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MyTetragon, MyTriangle
    public class MyPolygon
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polygon
    Implements a convex polygon in the Cartesian plane
    The constructors do not chack if the polygon is convex

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MyPolygon​(MyPoint2D[] p)
      Initializes a polygon by means of its vertices

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double area()
      computes the area of this convex polygon
      int compareTo​(Polygon p)
      compares this polygon and the specified polygon by thei area
      java.lang.String getName()
      provides the name of this convex polygon based on the number of sides
      Example: triangle, square, tetragon, pentagon, ..., n-gon
      double[] getSides()
      provides an array containing the sides of the polygon
      MyPoint2D getVertex​(int index)
      provides the vertex in this polygon identified with the specified index
      MyPoint2D[] getVertices()
      provides an array containing the sorted vertices of this convex polygon
      double perimeter()
      computes the polygon perimeter
      java.lang.String toString()
      provides the textual descrition of this poligon in the format POLYGON_NAME p1 p2 ...

        public MyPolygon​(MyPoint2D[] p)
        Initializes a polygon by means of its vertices
        Parameters:
        p - array containing the polygon vertices
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the vertices of the polygon are not at least three or if any of the vertices is null

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Polygon p)
        compares this polygon and the specified polygon by thei area
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Polygon>
        Parameters:
        p - the specified polygon
        Returns:
        0 if the two polygons are equivalent in the comparison, a negative integer if this polygon precedes the specified polygon, otherwise a positive number

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        provides the textual descrition of this poligon in the format POLYGON_NAME p1 p2 ... pn, where p1 ..., pn are the vertices of this polygon
